PHPRuntime.name: php_version
PHPRuntime.help: Your PHP version must be between PHP 5.3 and PHP 5.3.15.

PHPExtension.name: curl
PHPExtension.help: PHP supports libcurl, a library created by Daniel Stenberg, that allows you to connect and communicate to many different types of servers with many different types of protocols.

PHPExtension.name: zip
PHPExtension.help: This extension enables you to transparently read or write ZIP compressed archives and the files inside them.

PHPExtension.name: json
PHPExtension.help: This PHP extension implements the JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) data-interchange format. The decoding is handled by a parser based on the JSON_checker by Douglas Crockford.

PHPExtension.name: spl
PHPExtension.help: SPL is a collection of interfaces and classes that are meant to solve standard problems.

PHPExtension.name: dom
PHPExtension.help: The DOM extension allows you to operate on XML documents through the DOM API with PHP 5.

PHPExtension.name: mbstring
PHPExtension.help: mbstring provides multibyte specific string functions that help you deal with multibyte encodings in PHP.

PHPExtension.name: svn
PHPExtension.help: This extension implements PHP bindings for Subversion (SVN), a version control system, allowing PHP scripts to communicate with SVN repositories and working copies without direct command line calls to the svn executable.

PHPExtension.name: suhosin
PHPExtension.help: Suhosin is an advanced protection system for PHP installations. It was designed to protect servers and users from known and unknown flaws in PHP applications and the PHP core.

PHPINIValue.name: magic_quotes_gpc
PHPINIValue.help: Magic Quotes is a process that automagically escapes incoming data to the PHP script. It's preferred to code with magic quotes off and to instead escape the data at runtime, as needed.

PHPINIValue.name: short_open_tag
PHPINIValue.help: Tells PHP whether the short form (<? ?>) of PHP's open tag should be allowed. If you want to use PHP in combination with XML, you can disable this option in order to use <?xml ?> inline. Otherwise, you can print it with PHP, for example: <?php echo '<?xml version="1.0"?>'; ?>. Also, if disabled, you must use the long form of the PHP open tag (<?php ?>).

PHPINIValue.name: register_globals
PHPINIValue.help: The mod_rewrite module uses a rule-based rewriting engine, based on a PCRE regular-expression parser, to rewrite requested URLs on the fly.

custom.name: mod_rewrite
custom.help: The mod_rewrite module uses a rule-based rewriting engine, based on a PCRE regular-expression parser, to rewrite requested URLs on the fly.

custom.name: database_drivers
custom.help: Database drivers supported by the TAO platform are mysql and pgsql.
